owl:Ontology.dc:description: The Friend of a Friend (FOAF) RDF vocabulary, described using W3C RDF Schema and the Web Ontology Language.
owl:Ontology.dc:title: Friend of a Friend (FOAF) vocabulary

Enrollment and use of user-provided authentication devices, such as U2F or FIDO tokens, must be supported
PBKDF2 iteration count as large as verification server performance will allow
approved cryptographic algorithms used in the generation, seeding, and verification
approved cryptographic algorithms used in the generation, seeding, and verification of OTPs
at least 112 bits of entropy, or if less, salted with a unique 32-bit salt and hashed securely
at least 20 bits of entropy using a secure random number generator
at least 32 bits long, chosen randomly, and stored uniquely with each hash
at least 64 bits

communication over a secure independent channel

identity proofing
intra-service secrets do not rely on unchanging credentials
lookup secrets are resistant to offline attacks
lookup secrets can be used only once
minimum 12 characters, maximum 128 characters
minimum 64 bits, statistically unique or unique over the lifetime of the cryptographic device
mutually authenticated TLS is used between a CSP and the application if they are separate
no composition rules limiting character types
no periodic credential rotation or password history requirements
no truncation of user-set passwords and consecutive multiple spaces may be replaced by a single space
not sent in clear text to user
notification to user

password hints or knowledge-based authentication (so-called secret questions) are not present
passwords, API keys, and secrets are securely stored, not in source code, using HSM

passwords are stored with sufficient protection

push notifications preferred, no sensitive information in SMS or email

securely random, at least 6 characters, may include letters, numbers, expire quickly, and must not be long-term

shared or default accounts are not present (e.g. root, admin, or sa)
strength meter
sufficient time to renew time bound authenticators
symmetric keys used to verify submitted OTPs are highly protected
time-based OTP can be used only once within the validity period
time-based OTPs have a defined lifetime before expiring
use of digital signatures, encryption, and other measures
work factor should be as large as verification server performance will allow, with a minimum of 10

password characters
password composition
password configuration
password helpers
password length

password strength

password rotation and history
salting and hashing
service authentication
session token exposure
unauthorized session resume
session tokens generation using approved cryptographic algorithms
Requirement for the manufacturer to verify that user-set passwords are at least 12 characters and no more than 128 characters in length

owl:NamedIndividual.condition: if the session is inactive beyond a maximum authentication time
owl:NamedIndividual.name: Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify Relying Parties set a maximum authentication time, and CSPs re-authenticate users if the session is inactive beyond this period
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify an additional key derivation iteration with a secret salt, generated securely, and stored separately from hashed passwords
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify intent to authenticate by requiring an OTP entry or user action like pressing a FIDO hardware key
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify password credential recovery does not reveal the current password in any way
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify password hints or knowledge-based authentication (so-called secret questions) are not present
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify passwords, API keys, and secrets are securely stored, not in source code, using HSM to resist offline attacks (HSM)
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify passwords are salted and hashed with a secure function, using a salt and cost factor to resist offline attacks
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify protection against phishing using multi-factor authentication, cryptographic devices, or client-side certificates at higher security levels

owl:NamedIndividual.condition: if authenticators permit users to remain logged in
owl:NamedIndividual.name: Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify re-authentication with 2FA occurs every 12 hours of active use or after 15 minutes of inactivity, if authenticators permit users to remain logged in
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify replay resistance by using OTPs, cryptographic authenticators, or lookup codes
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify secure notifications after updates to authentication details, preferring push notifications, with no sensitive info in SMS or email
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify shared or default accounts are not present (e.g. root, admin, or sa)
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that CSPs inform Relying Parties of the last authentication event to help determine if re-authentication is needed
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that a password strength meter is provided to help users set a stronger password
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that a stolen physical OTP generator can be revoked immediately, affecting all active sessions regardless of location
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that a system generated initial activation or recovery secret is not sent in clear text to the user

Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that anti-automation controls (e.g., CAPTCHA, rate limiting) prevent brute force and breached credential attacks, allowing max 100 failed attempts per hour
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that any printable Unicode character, including spaces and Emojis, is permitted in passwords, without composition rules limiting character types
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that approved cryptographic algorithms are used in the generation, seeding, and verification
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that approved cryptographic algorithms are used in the generation, seeding, and verification of OTPs
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that biometric authenticators are used only as secondary factors, alongside something you have and something you know
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that cookie-based session tokens have the 'HttpOnly' attribute set
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that cookie-based session tokens have the 'Secure' attribute set
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that cookie-based session tokens use the '__Host-' prefix so cookies are only sent to the host that initially set the cookie
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that cookie-based session tokens utilize the 'SameSite' attribute to limit exposure to cross-site request forgery attacks
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that cryptographic keys used in verification are stored securely and protected against disclosure
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that enrollment and use of user-provided authentication devices are supported, such as a U2F or FIDO tokens
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that if OTP or MFA factors are lost, that evidence of identity proofing is performed at the same level as during enrollment
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that if PBKDF2 is used, the iteration count should be as large as verification server performance will allow
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that if a time-based multi-factor OTP token is re-used during the validity period, it is logged and rejected with notifications to the device holder
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that if an authentication factor is changed or replaced, that the user is notified of this event
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that if bcrypt is used, the work factor should be as large as verification server performance will allow, with a minimum of 10
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that if passwords are required for service authentication, the service account used is not a default credential (HSM)
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that initial authentication codes are generated with at least 20 bits of entropy using a secure random number generator
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that initial passwords are securely random, at least 6 characters, may include letters, numbers, expire quickly, and they must not be long-term
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that intra-service secrets do not rely on unchanging credentials (HSM)
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that less secure authentication methods like SMS are not default and that stronger options like push notifications are offered first
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that logout and expiration invalidate the session token, preventing session resume via the back button or other relying parties
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that lookup secrets are resistant to offline attacks, such as predictable values
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that lookup secrets can be used only once
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that lookup secrets have at least 112 bits of entropy, or if less, are salted with a unique 32-bit salt and hashed securely
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that mutually authenticated TLS is used between a CSP and the application if they are separate
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that out-of-band codes or tokens are single-use and valid only for the original authentication request
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that password recovery uses secure methods like TOTP, mobile push, or offline mechanisms
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that password truncation is not performed. However, consecutive multiple spaces may be replaced by a single space
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that passwords are stored with sufficient protection to prevent offline recovery attacks (HSM)
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that passwords submitted during account registration, login, and password change are checked against a set of breached passwords
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that paste functionality, browser password helpers, and external password managers are permitted
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that renewal instructions are sent with sufficient time to renew time bound authenticators
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that salts are at least 32 bits long, chosen randomly, and stored uniquely with each hash to prevent collisions
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that session cookies use the most precise path attribute possible to limit access to the specific application, especially on shared domains
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that session tokens are generated using approved cryptographic algorithms
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that session tokens possess at least 64 bits of entropy
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that stateless session tokens use digital signatures, encryption, and other measures to guard against tampering, replay, and key substitution attacks
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that symmetric keys used to verify submitted OTPs are highly protected
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that the challenge nonce is at least 64 bits in length, and statistically unique or unique over the lifetime of the cryptographic device
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that the out of band authenticator and verifier communicates over a secure independent channel
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that the out of band verifier expires out of band authentication requests, codes, or tokens after 10 minutes
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that the out of band verifier retains only a hashed version of the authentication code
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that there are no periodic credential rotation or password history requirements
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that time-based OTP can be used only once within the validity period
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that time-based OTPs have a defined lifetime before expiring
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that users can temporarily view the entire masked password or the last typed character on platforms without built-in functionality

Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify that weak authenticators (SMS, email) are limited to secondary use, stronger methods are prioritized, and users are informed of risks with safeguards in place
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify the app allows terminating all active sessions after a password change, including federated logins and relying parties
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify the application allows users to revoke OAuth tokens that form trust relationships with linked applications
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify the application generates a new session token on user authentication
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify the application never reveals session tokens in URL parameters
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify the application only stores session tokens in the browser using secure methods such as appropriately secured cookies or HTML 5 session storage
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify the application requires a full login session or re-authentication for sensitive transactions or account modifications
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify the application uses session tokens rather than static API secrets and keys, except with legacy implementations
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify users can change their password and that the password change functionality requires both the user's current and new password
Requirement that the manufacturer shall verify users can view and log out of any or all active sessions and devices by re-entering their login credentials
cookies are only sent to the host that initially set the cookie
logout and expiration invalidate the session token
re-authentication with 2FA every 12 hours or after 15 minutes of inactivity
session management
session tokens stored in the browser using secure methods
termination of all active sessions
view and logout of active sessions
CSPs re-authenticate users
Verify replay resistance mechanisms
authentication management
ensuring Relying Parties is informed
identity proofing after loss of OTP or MFA factors
logging and rejecting re-used OTP token with notifications
notifying user of authentication factor change
out of band verifier expires out of band authentication requests, codes, or tokens after 10 minutes
password credential recovery
protect password
protect initial password
session management
session token management
session token storage
token management
updating authentication details
user authentication
user-set password
using OTP entry or user action like pressing a FIDO hardware key
using OTPs, cryptographic authenticators, or lookup codes
using multi-factor authentication, cryptographic devices, or client-side certificates at higher security levels
using secure methods as TOTP, mobile push, or offline mechanisms
using strong authentication methods like push notifications
validating challenge nonce length
validating initial authentication codes policy
validating look-up secrets entropy
validating password handling
validating password length
verify user intent to authenticate
verifying CSPs inform Relying Parties of the last authentication event
verifying OAuth token revocation
verifying anti-automation controls prevent brute force and breached credential attacks
verifying evidence of identity proofing is performed at the same level as during enrollment
verifying full login or re-authentication for sensitive transactions or account modifications
verifying less secure authentication methods are not default
verifying out of band verifier policy
verifying password against breached password list
verifying password change functionality
verifying password is not revealed
verifying password recovery uses secure methods
verifying protection against phishing
verifying re-authentication with 2FA after 12 hours of active use or 15 minutes of inactivity
verifying sending of secure notifications
verifying session management
verifying session management functionalities
verifying session termination after password change
verifying session token exposure
verifying session token generation
verifying session token invalidation
verifying session token storage methods
verifying stolen physical OTP generator can be revoked immediately
verifying strong authenticators are prioritized
verifying system generated initial activation or recovery secret not sent in clear text to user
verifying that renewal instructions are sent with sufficient time to renew time bound authenticators
verifying that users can temporarily view the entire masked password or the last typed character
verifying time-based multi-factor OTP token reuse policy
verifying user notification upon authentication factor change
